info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Blowing Dust Advisory issued May 5 at 6:46PM MDT until May 5 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Visibility between one-quarter and one mile in blowing dust.
* WHERE...In New Mexico, Southern Dona Ana County/Mesilla Valley and West Central Tularosa Basin/White Sands. In Texas, Eastern/Central El Paso County, Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso/Western Hudspeth Counties, and Western El Paso County.
* WHEN...Until 9 PM MDT this evening.
* IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to reduced visibility.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Showers and weak storms over Southern New Mexico are producing outflow winds of 30 to 40 mph, which are pushing east towards the I-10 corridor between Las Cruces and Central El Paso. These outflow boundaries are picking up dust and pushing it east into the Rio Grande Valley.
info.instruction: Persons with respiratory problems should make preparations to stay indoors until the storm passes. Be ready for a sudden drop in visibility to near zero. If you encounter blowing dust or blowing sand on the roadway or see it approaching, pull off the road as far as possible and put your vehicle in park. Turn the lights all the way off and keep foot off the brake pedal. Remember, 'Pull Aside, Stay Alive'.

parameter.value: BLOWING DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Southern Dona Ana County/Mesilla Valley; West Central Tularosa Basin/White Sands; Western El Paso County; Eastern/Central El Paso County; Rio Grande Valley of Eastern El Paso/Western Hudspeth Counties
